purpleculture_pinyin:
qǐ
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹 (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC); to open; to start; to initiate; to enlighten or awaken; to state; to inform
Ци сын Юя Великого 禹 (ок. 2070-ок. 1600 до н. Э.); открыть; начать; инициировать; просветить или пробудить; заявить; сообщить
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 启)
Ideographic: To knock 攵 on a door 启; 启 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
啟動 [ qǐ dòng ]: to start (a machine); (fig.) to set in motion; to launch (an operation); to activate (a plan)
啟示 [ qǐ shì ]: to reveal; to enlighten; enlightenment; revelation; illumination; moral (of a story etc); lesson
啟發 [ qǐ fā ]: to enlighten; to explain (a text etc); to stimulate (a mental attitude); enlightenment; revelation; motivation
啟迪 [ qǐ dí ]: to edify; enlightenment
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 启 [ qǐ ] to open; to begin, to commence; to explain
    • 攵 [ pū ] to rap, to tap; script; to let go
Ru_trainchinese: qǐ: (графема) открывать; начинать; вдохновлять, просвещать; излагать, информировать
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You have a conversation (mouth) which enlightens you allowing you to go through the next open door in your life path.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jiajin inscriptions start from " 𢻻 " from " mouth ", " 𢻻 " looks like opening a door with a hand. It is the first text of " Qi ". The original meaning is to open. Oracle or eliminating " and " as " start ." "Said the text": "Kai, also from the open door from the mouth.." Duan Note: "Start by descendants of the word open training, Kai is the waste not carry on." Ancient cave, " mouth of the cave within the" suspect as households (See Zhang Shichao, etc.). Or think that " kou " is just a decorative pen, and ancient characters often add " kou " to increase the complexity, such as " high " and " stone ".

Western Zhou Dynasty are from " households " from " and " from " mouth ", after the Warring States only see change from " and " from " Po ", " Shu ." West Zhou Dynasty from " households " from " Po " or " Ge shape" of a " Hajime beginning of the text", see " 𢻻 ", " Hajime ." In terms of usage, the oracle bone inscription means report, and it is also pronounced "晵", which means it is sunny. The inscriptions inscribed on the development, Zhongshan Wangding: "Opening Qifengqiang (Jiangong)", Zhongshan Wangyuanhu: "Daqi Bangyu". It also means enlightenment and enlightenment. Uncle Yu Gui said: "Guang Qi Yu body", Shifu Zhong: "Use Guang Qi Shi father body." One said "Guang Qi" " Qi " means blessing and assisting (Yang Shuda). Also used as clan name, person name, place name, etc. Unsealing order carbuncle: "Unsealing". "Qifeng" was the place of Wei during the Warring States Period, and later changed its name to "Kaifeng" because of avoiding the emperor of Han Jing, Liu Qiqi.

"Shuowen": "Enlighten, teach. From Wei Qisheng. "The Analects of Confucius" said: "Don't be angry or open."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen starts from " 𢻻 " from " mouth "," 𢻻 " looks like opening a door with a hand. It is the first text of " Qi ". The original meaning is to open.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「𢻻」從「口」，「𢻻」象以手開門之形，是「啟」的初文，本義是開啟。甲骨文或省去「又」作「启」。《說文》：「启，開也。从戶从口。」段玉裁注：「按後人用啟字訓開，乃廢启不行矣。」古人穴居，「口」疑象戶內之山洞(參張世超等)。或認為「口」只是飾筆，古文字往往加「口」以增繁，如「高」、「石」等字。

　　西周金文皆從「戶」從「又」從「口」，戰國以後始見改從「又」為從「攴」、「殳」。西周金文從「戶」從「攴」或「戈」之形是「肇」的初文，參見「𢻻」、「肇」。用法方面，甲骨文表示禀告，又讀作「晵」，表示天晴。金文表示開闢，中山王鼎：「闢啟封彊(疆)」，中山王圓壺：「大啟邦宇」。又表示啟迪、啟發，叔向父禹簋：「廣啟禹身」，士父鐘：「用廣啟士父身。」一說「廣啟」之「啟」表示佑助、輔助(楊樹達)。又用作族氏名、人名、地名等。啟封令癰戈：「啟封」。「啟封」是戰國時魏地，後因避漢景帝劉啟諱，改稱「開封」。

　　《說文》：「啟，教也。从攴启聲。《論語》曰：『不憤不啟。』」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「𢻻」從「口」，「𢻻」象以手開門之形，是「啟」的初文，本義是開啟。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
啟 (Simplified: 启)
Pinyin: qǐ
English Definition: Qi son of Yu the Great 禹 (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC); to open; to start; to initiate; to enlighten or awaken; to state; to inform
Total strokes: 11; Radical: 口
Ideographic: To knock 攵 on a door 启; 启 also provides the pronunciation
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 启 [ qǐ ] to open; to begin, to commence; to explain
    • 攵 [ pū ] to rap, to tap; script; to let go
Example Words:
啟動 [ qǐ dòng ]: to start (a machine); (fig.) to set in motion; to launch (an operation); to activate (a plan)
啟示 [ qǐ shì ]: to reveal; to enlighten; enlightenment; revelation; illumination; moral (of a story etc); lesson
啟發 [ qǐ fā ]: to enlighten; to explain (a text etc); to stimulate (a mental attitude); enlightenment; revelation; motivation
啟迪 [ qǐ dí ]: to edify; enlightenment
More: 啟* | *啟 | *啟*

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 啓 flip-variant 啟 from hand-action 攵攴 pū and door (户)戶戸 hù and (rem+ 口 kǒu window) C451 啓<啟唘> A195 启[啓] simp 启. (name- door-open (启)𢻻𢼄啓啟 qǐ)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- start by opening the window or door to start work)

Meaning: enlighten

Story: You have a conversation (mouth) which enlightens you allowing you to go through the next open door in your life path.
Kind: traditional

甲金文從「 𢻻 」從「 口 」，「 𢻻 」象以手開門之形，是「 啟 」的初文，本義是開啟。甲骨文或省去「 又 」作「 启 」。《說文》：「启，開也。从戶从口。」段玉裁注：「按後人用啟字訓開，乃廢启不行矣。」古人穴居，「 口 」疑象戶內之山洞(參張世超等)。或認為「 口 」只是飾筆，古文字往往加「 口 」以增繁，如「 高 」、「 石 」等字。 西周金文皆從「 戶 」從「 又 」從「 口 」，戰國以後始見改從「 又 」為從「 攴 」、「 殳 」。西周金文從「 戶 」從「 攴 」或「 戈 」之形是「 肇 」的初文，參見「 𢻻 」、「 肇 」。用法方面，甲骨文表示禀告，又讀作「 晵 」，表示天晴。金文表示開闢，中山王鼎：「闢啟封彊(疆)」，中山王圓壺：「大啟邦宇」。又表示啟迪、啟發，叔向父禹簋：「廣啟禹身」，士父鐘：「用廣啟士父身。」一說「廣啟」之「 啟 」表示佑助、輔助(楊樹達)。又用作族氏名、人名、地名等。啟封令癰戈：「啟封」。「啟封」是戰國時魏地，後因避漢景帝劉啟諱，改稱「開封」。 《說文》：「啟，教也。从攴启聲。《論語》曰：『不憤不啟。』」

啟字的基本解释

啟
qǐ
同“启”。

啟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qǐ］
［《廣韻》康禮切，上薺，溪。］
“唘1”的今字。“啔1”的今字。亦作“啟1”。亦作“闙1”。
(1)开；打开。
(2)分开。
(3)开拓；开创。
(4)通；开通。
(5)开导；启发。
(6)指门户；道桥。参见“啓塞”。
(7)古时指立春、立夏。
(8)始；开始。
(9)招致；引发。
(10)启奏；禀告。
(11)泛指奏疏，公文，书函。
(12)先锋。
(13)引申指先进的，前头的。
(14)指军队的左翼。
(15)跪；危坐。
(16)视。后作“”。
(17)马之一种，称前右足白者。
(18)姓。

啟字的康熙字典解释
啟字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
啟字的起名意思

同"启"。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [qǐ]
["Guangyun" Kang Liqie, upper water chestnut, stream. ]
The present character of "唘1". The present character of "啔1". Also known as "Revelation 1". Also known as "Qui 1".
(1) Open; open.
(2) Separate.
(3) Pioneering; pioneering.
(4) Open; open.
(5) Enlighten; enlighten.
(6) Refers to the portal; Daoqiao. See "opening".
(7) In ancient times, it referred to Lichun and Lixia.
(8) Begin; begin.
(9) Incurred; triggered.
(10) Initiation; report.
(11) Refers to memorials, official documents, and letters in general.
(12) Pioneer.
(13) The extension refers to the advanced and the first.
(14) Refers to the left wing of the army.
(15) Kneel; sit in danger.
(16) Depending on. It is later called "".
(17) A kind of horse, which is called white front right foot.
(18) Last name.
